reading_passages.title: About Economics
reading_passages.text: Module 5 Economics In this module, you will learn how economics plays an important role in the way people interact throughout the world.
reading_passages.main_idea: Module 5 Economics In this module, you will learn how economics plays an important role in the way people interact throughout the world.

reading_passages.text: Factors of Production Teen Chef Natural Resources Are Economic Resources Key Terms Review Reading Check Graphic Organizer Activity Lesson AssessmentGraph: Supply and Demand Document-Based Investigation: Availability of ResourcesVisualsMaps, Graphs, and ChartsVideos AssessmentExtend and EnrichSources Economics 158a Online Lesson 1 Enrichment Activities Natural Resources Are Economic Resources Article Students read about the connection of natural resources to the economies of selected nations, then create a poster or digital display of these resources. Teen Chef Video Students watch a video about 16-year-old Flynn McGarry opening his own New York restaurant, then make a poster of a business they might create themselves.

scientific_phenomena.title: Economics Mountain
scientific_phenomena.description: For exam- ple, a town in a mountain ski area might determine the opportunity cost of regulations to preserve land versus the rights of property owners to develop it for tourism. Then, it must make tradeoffs.
observation_prompts: What features of mountain can you identify in Economics?
How might mountain affect people living in Economics?
What patterns do you notice about mountain in Economics?

scientific_phenomena.title: Economics Ocean
scientific_phenomena.description: The first factor of production is natural resources, such as oceans, mines, and forests, that provide the raw materials needed to produce goods. Another important natural resource for businesses is land. Every business needs a place to locate.
observation_prompts: What features of ocean can you identify in Economics?
How might ocean affect people living in Economics?
What patterns do you notice about ocean in Economics?

scientific_phenomena.title: Economics Environment
scientific_phenomena.description: These regulations often include protections for public health and safety and the environment. For exam- ple, a town in a mountain ski area might determine the opportunity cost of regulations to preserve land versus the rights of property owners to develop it for tourism. Then, it must make tradeoffs.
observation_prompts: What features of environment can you identify in Economics?
How might environment affect people living in Economics?
What patterns do you notice about environment in Economics?

scientific_phenomena.title: Economics Environment
scientific_phenomena.description: Governments create business regulations in order to protect the public’s health and safety, and to protect the environment. Therefore, governments create sets of rules or laws that limit business activities. For example, a tourist company must respect the rights of property owners and the environment in order to operate.
observation_prompts: What features of environment can you identify in Economics?
How might environment affect people living in Economics?
What patterns do you notice about environment in Economics?

scientific_phenomena.title: Economics Forest
scientific_phenomena.description: The first factor of production is natural resources, such as oceans, mines, and forests, that provide the raw materials needed to produce goods. Another important natural resource for businesses is land. Every business needs a place to locate.
observation_prompts: What features of forest can you identify in Economics?
How might forest affect people living in Economics?
What patterns do you notice about forest in Economics?

writing_prompts: Using information from the passage and your own knowledge, write an informative paragraph about Economics. Include at least three vocabulary terms from Part 1.
Describe an important geographic feature of Economics and explain its significance to the region.
Compare and contrast two aspects of Economics discussed in the reading passage.
reflection_questions: What new information did you learn about Economics?
What questions do you still have about Economics?
How does learning about Economics help you understand our world better?
How might life in Economics be similar to or different from your own?

system_identification.title: HUMAN GEOGRAPHY SYSTEMS
system_identification.instructions: Label each description with the correct human geography system: Urban, Cultural, Economic, Political, or Infrastructure.
